pair.h: Arming Libyan rebels has a military impact on the rebels combat abilities and in ousting Gaddafi from power

pair.t: Yet the rebels have as yet no command and control they serve a political entity if that is not too generous a way to describe the councils that have been set up in eastern Libya that is recognized as legitimate by France alone
pair.h: Arming Libyan rebels has a military impact on the rebels combat abilities and in ousting Gaddafi from power

pair.t: There is no way to police the rebels conduct or to hold them accountable for their actions on the battlefield
pair.h: Arming Libyan rebels has a military impact on the rebels combat abilities and in ousting Gaddafi from power

pair.t: The alternative to arming the rebels is almost certainly many thousands executed and thousands more disappeared by Gaddafi s military and secret police though
pair.h: Arming Libyan rebels has a military impact on the rebels combat abilities and in ousting Gaddafi from power

pair.t: Random breath tests help deter drunk driving
pair.h: Random sobriety tests for drivers are effective at deterring drunk driving

pair.t: A 1995 review by the European Transport Safety Council concluded There is wide agreement in the international scientific literature that increasing driver s perception of the risk of being detected for excess alcohol is a very important element in any package of measures to reduce alcohol related crashes
pair.h: Random sobriety tests for drivers are effective at deterring drunk driving

pair.t: Random breath testing doesn t necessarily lower drunk driving
pair.h: Random sobriety tests for drivers are effective at deterring drunk driving

pair.t: Many countries have had random testing for some time and have seen no real fall in drink driving figures
pair.h: Random sobriety tests for drivers are effective at deterring drunk driving

pair.t: Little evidence random alcohol tests deter drunk driving
pair.h: Random breath testing doesn t necessarily lower drunk driving Many countries have had random testing for some time and have seen no real fall in drink driving figures

pair.t: There is a dearth of research regarding the deterrent effect of checkpoints
pair.h: Random breath testing doesn t necessarily lower drunk driving Many countries have had random testing for some time and have seen no real fall in drink driving figures

pair.t: The only formally documented research regarding deterrence is a survey of Maryland s Checkpoint Strikeforce program
pair.h: Random breath testing doesn t necessarily lower drunk driving Many countries have had random testing for some time and have seen no real fall in drink driving figures

pair.t: The survey found no deterrent effect To date there is no evidence to indicate that this campaign which involves a number of sobriety checkpoints and media activities to promote these efforts has had any impact on public perceptions driver behaviors or alcohol related motor vehicle crashes and injuries
pair.h: Random breath testing doesn t necessarily lower drunk driving Many countries have had random testing for some time and have seen no real fall in drink driving figures

pair.t: This conclusion is drawn after examining statistics for alcohol related crashes police citations for impaired driving and public perceptions of alcohol impaired driving risk
pair.h: Random breath testing doesn t necessarily lower drunk driving Many countries have had random testing for some time and have seen no real fall in drink driving figures

pair.t: Random alcohol breath tests reduce accidents save lives
pair.h: Random sobriety tests for drivers are effective at deterring drunk driving

pair.t: The Centers for Disease Control in a 2002 Traffic Injury Prevention report found that in general the number of alcohol related crashes was reduced by 20 in states that implement sobriety checkpoints compared to those that do not
pair.h: Random sobriety tests for drivers are effective at deterring drunk driving

pair.t: Repeat drunk drivers unlikely to respond to random breath testing deterrence
pair.h: Random alcohol breath tests reduce accidents save lives The Centers for Disease Control in a 2002 Traffic Injury Prevention report found that in general the number of alcohol related crashes was reduced by 20 in states that implement sobriety checkpoints compared to those that do not

pair.t: One statistic the MAD bunch doesn t like to mention is the fact that half of the people killed by drunk drivers have at least double the legal blood alcohol limit
pair.h: Random alcohol breath tests reduce accidents save lives The Centers for Disease Control in a 2002 Traffic Injury Prevention report found that in general the number of alcohol related crashes was reduced by 20 in states that implement sobriety checkpoints compared to those that do not

pair.t: They don t like it because it implies that on a sliding scale drivers who are barely over the legal limit are probably not that bad
pair.h: Random alcohol breath tests reduce accidents save lives The Centers for Disease Control in a 2002 Traffic Injury Prevention report found that in general the number of alcohol related crashes was reduced by 20 in states that implement sobriety checkpoints compared to those that do not

pair.t: It suggests that problems associated with drunk driving are overwhelmingly caused by a small cadre of hard core problem drinkers who are sloshed behind the wheel
pair.h: Random alcohol breath tests reduce accidents save lives The Centers for Disease Control in a 2002 Traffic Injury Prevention report found that in general the number of alcohol related crashes was reduced by 20 in states that implement sobriety checkpoints compared to those that do not

pair.t: Unfortunately these are also the people who are the least responsive to legal incentives so MAD and the law targets ordinary people who have a glass or two of sherry instead
pair.h: Random alcohol breath tests reduce accidents save lives The Centers for Disease Control in a 2002 Traffic Injury Prevention report found that in general the number of alcohol related crashes was reduced by 20 in states that implement sobriety checkpoints compared to those that do not

pair.t: Random alcohol tests are more effective than alternative measures
pair.h: Random sobriety tests for drivers are effective at deterring drunk driving

pair.t: The federal Justice Department of Canada moved to implement Random Breath Testing RBT concluding a system of random checks is more effective than a combination of other measures such as a lower threshold for blood alcohol level and more frequent RIDE checkpoints
pair.h: Random sobriety tests for drivers are effective at deterring drunk driving

pair.t: The majority of people caught drink driving have not been from random breath tests
pair.h: Random alcohol tests are more effective than alternative measures The federal Justice Department of Canada moved to implement Random Breath Testing RBT concluding a system of random checks is more effective than a combination of other measures such as a lower threshold for blood alcohol level and more frequent RIDE checkpoints

pair.t: They have been from tip offs police chases and police pulling over suspects not random breath testing
pair.h: Random alcohol tests are more effective than alternative measures The federal Justice Department of Canada moved to implement Random Breath Testing RBT concluding a system of random checks is more effective than a combination of other measures such as a lower threshold for blood alcohol level and more frequent RIDE checkpoints

pair.t: If Social Security were privatized people would deposit their income with a bank
pair.h: Privatizing social security improves economic growth

pair.t: People actually save resources that businesses can invest
pair.h: Privatizing social security improves economic growth

pair.t: We as true savers get more resources in the future

pair.t: Creating private accounts could dampen economic growth which would further weaken social security s future finances
pair.h: If Social Security were privatized people would deposit their income with a bank People actually save resources that businesses can invest We as true savers get more resources in the future

pair.t: Privatizing Social Security will increase federal deficits and debt significantly while increasing the likelihood that national savings will decline
pair.h: If Social Security were privatized people would deposit their income with a bank People actually save resources that businesses can invest We as true savers get more resources in the future

pair.t: Social Security drains capital from the poorest areas of the country leaving less money available for new investment and job creation
pair.h: Privatizing social security improves economic growth

pair.t: Privatization would increase national savings and provide a new pool of capital for investment that would be particularly beneficial to the poor
pair.h: Privatizing social security improves economic growth

pair.t: Privatization would not increase capital for investment
pair.h: Social Security drains capital from the poorest areas of the country leaving less money available for new investment and job creation Privatization would increase national savings and provide a new pool of capital for investment that would be particularly beneficial to the poor

pair.t: The problem is that for every dollar put into the market through a private account the government would have to borrow a dollar in the market to cover existing payouts
pair.h: Social Security drains capital from the poorest areas of the country leaving less money available for new investment and job creation Privatization would increase national savings and provide a new pool of capital for investment that would be particularly beneficial to the poor

pair.t: Thus the supposed benefit is entirely eliminated as the net impact on the capital available for investment is zero
pair.h: Social Security drains capital from the poorest areas of the country leaving less money available for new investment and job creation Privatization would increase national savings and provide a new pool of capital for investment that would be particularly beneficial to the poor

pair.t: Internet access is essential now must be a right
pair.h: Internet access is fundamental in modernity

pair.t: The internet is only that wire that delivers freedom of speech freedom of assembly and freedom of the press in a single connection
pair.h: Internet access is fundamental in modernity

pair.h: Internet access is essential now must be a right The internet is only that wire that delivers freedom of speech freedom of assembly and freedom of the press in a single connection

pair.t: Just because they re widespread and is used extensively doesn t mean that they should be rights
pair.h: Internet access is essential now must be a right The internet is only that wire that delivers freedom of speech freedom of assembly and freedom of the press in a single connection

pair.t: Internet not as important as real rights
pair.h: Internet access is fundamental in modernity

pair.t: We may think of such trivial things as a fundamental right but consider the truly impoverished and what is most important to them
pair.h: Internet access is fundamental in modernity

pair.t: The right to vote the right to liberty and freedom from slavery or the right to elementary education
pair.h: Internet access is fundamental in modernity

pair.t: Perhaps it s time for a reality check and to re examine which of our rights are truly important
pair.h: Internet access is fundamental in modernity

pair.t: Internet access is essential to other human rights United Nations Universal Declaration of Human Rights includes the right to education and the right to work which may hinge on Internet access
pair.h: Internet access is fundamental in modernity

pair.t: And indeed The European Parliament has ruled that it sees internet access as critical for the practical exercise of a wide array of fundamental rights
pair.h: Internet access is fundamental in modernity

pair.t: I ve seen the growing awareness within the developing world that computers and connectivity matter and can be useful
pair.h: Internet not as important as real rights We may think of such trivial things as a fundamental right but consider the truly impoverished and what is most important to them The right to vote the right to liberty and freedom from slavery or the right to elementary education Perhaps it s time for a reality check and to re examine which of our rights are truly important

pair.t: It s not that computers matter more than water food shelter and healthcare but that the network and PCs can be used to ensure that those other things are available
pair.h: Internet not as important as real rights We may think of such trivial things as a fundamental right but consider the truly impoverished and what is most important to them The right to vote the right to liberty and freedom from slavery or the right to elementary education Perhaps it s time for a reality check and to re examine which of our rights are truly important

pair.t: Satellite imagery sent to a local computer can help villages find fresh water mobile phones can tell farmers the prices at market so they know when to harvest
pair.h: Internet not as important as real rights We may think of such trivial things as a fundamental right but consider the truly impoverished and what is most important to them The right to vote the right to liberty and freedom from slavery or the right to elementary education Perhaps it s time for a reality check and to re examine which of our rights are truly important

pair.t: The same arguments apply in the UK but those of us who have easy affordable and fast connectivity tend not to think of the plight of those who can t get online just as we so often fail to notice the homeless people in our towns or let our eyes glide over deprived housing estates as we sit on the train
pair.h: Internet not as important as real rights We may think of such trivial things as a fundamental right but consider the truly impoverished and what is most important to them The right to vote the right to liberty and freedom from slavery or the right to elementary education Perhaps it s time for a reality check and to re examine which of our rights are truly important

pair.t: Name Cordoba House indicates nefarious intent of mosque
pair.h: Name Cordoba House is a very direct historical indication that the Ground Zero mosque is all about conquest and thus an assertion of Islamist triumphalism

pair.t: The true intentions of Rauf are also revealed by the name initially proposed for the Ground Zero mosque— Cordoba House — which is named for a city in Spain where a conquering Muslim army replaced a church with a mosque
pair.h: Name Cordoba House is a very direct historical indication that the Ground Zero mosque is all about conquest and thus an assertion of Islamist triumphalism
